cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles southwest of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the central-northwest Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Texas) mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas; parts of eastern and central Cuba under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, northern and southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Greater Antilles, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, Florida Keys, and a broad stretch of the U.S. Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle to Texas later in the week
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Illinois locations listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (1–3 inches possible if remnant passes nearby)
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of gusty winds (20–30 mph) possible late next week if the remnant low tracks over Illinois
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (inland river port, no coastal surge exposure)
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant tropical moisture could bring moderate rainfall totals Thursday–Friday, raising minor flooding concerns along the Illinois River
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential for temporary river-current rise and operational delays due to heavy rain and embedded thunderstorms; otherwise minimal tropical-cyclone hazards expected
